content: row ending with a ws row means you ve worked the ws row turned your work and are ready to begin a rs row remember to knit the 6 sts at each end tightly work 1 ¾ ins cc1 ending with a ws row work 2 row cc2 work 2 row cc1 work 2 row cc2 work 3 ½ ins cc1 ending with a ws row work 5 ½ ins mc ending with a ws row work 1 ¼ ins cc2 work 2 ¾ ins mc ending with a ws row work 2 ins cc2 ending with a ws row work 2 row cc1 work 2 row cc2 work 2 row cc1 work 2 row cc2 work 2 row cc1 © 2014 lynne nathan this pattern is for personal use only all rights reserved 3 work 1 ¼ ins cc2 ending with a ws row work 2 ½ 5 ½ ins mc ending with a ws row discontinue working in pattern change to us size 6 smaller needles work 12 row in garter st bobble all sts repeat from the beginning for the second piece vertical stripes the vertical stripes are added after you have finished knitting using a crochet hook you will chain stitch into the groove made by the purl sts hold yarn in back of work slip crochet hook through the lowest bar in the purl column hook yarn pull through and adjust loop repeat all the way up stopping when you reach the garter stitch section at the top fasten_off yarn in back keep the chain loose loops will settle after blocking with rs facing and co edge at bottom work the three vertical stripes closest to the right edge and the single stripe along the left edge in cc1 and the remaining two stripes on the left in cc2 repeat on the second piece finishing weave in ends block pieces lightly with steam to designated size pin and let dry joining pieces lay one piece out rs down co edge at top angled 45° to the right fold top fourth towards you so rs shows fold will be at shoulder now lay the second piece rs up angled to the left on top of the first piece with the bottom points even fold the shoulder edge under to the back so it meets the underneath piece adjust so the 12 garter stitch row overlap the 6 stitch garter stitch edging pin and sew in place buttons space 5 buttons evenly about 4 ins apart centered on the garter stitch sections and sew in place repeat on back questions or problems tell aunt ninny at ninnyknits@gmail com thanks to paula at white barn farm
